summary: I just watched Talks Machina for the first time, which was fun, but also solidified for me something I’ve been thinking about...
body:
I just watched Talks Machina for the first time, which was fun, but also solidified for me something I’ve been thinking about with Jester for at least a week.

People, both sending into the show and not, keep talking about Jester and jealousy and will she be jealous of Caduceus and is that gonna be weird for her and all of that. And the thing, for me as a kid who grew up in church is… YES. She’s jealous. But NOT in the way we THINK of jealousy by default.

I’m gonna use the Merriam-Webster dictionary to get at this so that hopefully it makes sense for people who didn’t grow up in church being taught “yes, it says God is a jealous God, but not like that.”

So, M-W has three definitions for “jealous.”

The first one, and the one that is the default most of the time when we use the word, is “hostile toward a rival or one believed to enjoy an advantage : envious,” and the second, which is similar and similarly popular, is “a. intolerant of rivalry or unfaithfulness … b. disposed to suspect rivalry or unfaithfulness” like we imagine with a jealous spouse.

I never really thought Jester was going to be jealous in either of those senses, and when she came back onto the show, she seemed not to be those things, really, and when Laura talks about her, she’s indicating that these are not big motivators for Jester.

The kind of jealous she IS, though, is the THIRD definition: “vigilant in guarding a possession.”

This is the kind of protective “jealousy” I grew up being encouraged to associate with God, and it doesn’t have to center on physical or monetary possessions. In fact, Merriam-Webster’s sample sentence for this definition shows that kind of usage: “new colonies were jealous of their new independence —Scott Buchanan”

Jester absolutely is jealous coming out of her ordeal. She’s trying to guard and protect her friends and her friendship with them. The whole “I have healing, though, don’t worry. I have healing. Who are you? I have healing,” thing looks a little like “hostility toward a rival” or “intolerance of rivalry” on the surface, but it seems pretty quickly apparent that that’s not what’s going on. There’s this stranger here and her friends are asking him about healing - something she has and can do - and apparently counting on him to do that for them, and her reaction is to emphasize (way more than the “who are you” part) that she has healing. She can heal them. She can help them. She is right here and can do something and wants to do it.

She can get along with Caduceus later and Laura can talk about her not being jealous later and make jokes about her own competitiveness coming through, but I think it’s also that kind of positive jealousy coming through. She cares about her friends and their relationship. She wants to protect her friends and reestablish/reinforce that relationship. Doing those things is really important to her. She’s jealous of her friends and their supportive relationships of helping each other. She wants to guard and protect those relationships. Could this bleed into moments that look like the other kinds of jealousy? Yeah. It think it could. But the way Laura plays her and the way she talked about her make me think it’s really always that third kind and just sometimes looks a little sketchier.

reblog.comment:

summary: Actually what I’m most looking forward to about tonight’s episode is the fact that Matt said that it would span “several weeks”...
body: Actually what I’m most looking forward to about tonight’s episode is the fact that Matt said that it would span “several weeks” of in-game time which means days and days of completely blank canon time that we’re free to fill with theories and fic and I think that’s a lovely gift
